intro: Meriania ramosii, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus *Eucalyptus*, through its haustoria, which extract water and nutrients. Due to its parasitic nature and limited distribution, Meriania ramosii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
